verses.verse: Maschil <WH4905> of Asaph.<WH623> Give ear,<WH238> O my people,<WH5971> to my law:<WH8451> incline<WH5186> your ears<WH241> to the words<WH561> of my mouth.<WH6310>
I will open<WH6605> my mouth<WH6310> in a parable:<WH4912> I will utter<WH5042> dark sayings<WH2420> of<WH4480> old: <WH6924>
Which <WH834> we have heard<WH8085> and known,<WH3045> and our fathers<WH1> have told<WH5608> us.

We will not<WH3808> hide<WH3582> them from their children,<WH4480> <WH1121> showing<WH5608> to the generation<WH1755> to come<WH314> the praises<WH8416> of the LORD,<WH3068> and his strength,<WH5807> and his wonderful works<WH6381> that<WH834> he hath done.<WH6213>

For he established<WH6965> a testimony<WH5715> in Jacob,<WH3290> and appointed<WH7760> a law<WH8451> in Israel,<WH3478> which<WH834> he commanded<WH6680> <WH853> our fathers,<WH1> that they should make them known<WH3045> to their children: <WH1121>

That <WH4616> the generation<WH1755> to come<WH314> might know<WH3045> them, even the children<WH1121> which should be born;<WH3205> who should arise<WH6965> and declare<WH5608> them to their children: <WH1121>
That they might set<WH7760> their hope<WH3689> in God,<WH430> and not<WH3808> forget<WH7911> the works<WH4611> of God,<WH410> but keep<WH5341> his commandments: <WH4687>

And might not<WH3808> be<WH1961> as their fathers,<WH1> a stubborn<WH5637> and rebellious<WH4784> generation;<WH1755> a generation<WH1755> that set not their heart aright,<WH3559> <WH3808> <WH3820> and whose spirit<WH7307> was not<WH3808> steadfast<WH539> with<WH854> God.<WH410>
The children<WH1121> of Ephraim,<WH669> being armed,<WH5401> and carrying<WH7411> bows,<WH7198> turned back<WH2015> in the day<WH3117> of battle.<WH7128>
They kept<WH8104> not<WH3808> the covenant<WH1285> of God,<WH430> and refused<WH3985> to walk<WH1980> in his law;<WH8451>
And forgot<WH7911> his works,<WH5949> and his wonders<WH6381> that<WH834> he had showed<WH7200> them.
Marvelous things<WH6382> did<WH6213> he in the sight<WH5048> of their fathers,<WH1> in the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> in the field<WH7704> of Zoan.<WH6814>
He divided<WH1234> the sea,<WH3220> and caused them to pass through;<WH5674> and he made the waters<WH4325> to stand<WH5324> as<WH3644> a heap.<WH5067>
In the daytime<WH3119> also he led<WH5148> them with a cloud,<WH6051> and all<WH3605> the night<WH3915> with a light<WH216> of fire.<WH784>
He cleaved<WH1234> the rocks<WH6697> in the wilderness,<WH4057> and gave them drink<WH8248> as out of the great<WH7227> depths.<WH8415>
He brought streams also out<WH3318> <WH5140> of the rock,<WH4480> <WH5553> and caused waters<WH4325> to run down<WH3381> like rivers.<WH5104>
And they sinned<WH2398> yet<WH5750> more<WH3254> against him by provoking<WH4784> the most High<WH5945> in the wilderness.<WH6723>
And they tempted<WH5254> God<WH410> in their heart<WH3824> by asking<WH7592> meat<WH400> for their lust.<WH5315>
Yea, they spoke<WH1696> against God;<WH430> they said,<WH559> Can<WH3201> God<WH410> furnish<WH6186> a table<WH7979> in the wilderness?<WH4057>

Behold, <WH2005> he smote<WH5221> the rock,<WH6697> that the waters<WH4325> gushed out,<WH2100> and the streams<WH5158> overflowed;<WH7857> can<WH3201> he give<WH5414> bread<WH3899> also?<WH1571> can he provide<WH3559> flesh<WH7607> for his people?<WH5971>

Therefore <WH3651> the LORD<WH3068> heard<WH8085> this, and was wroth:<WH5674> so a fire<WH784> was kindled<WH5400> against Jacob,<WH3290> and anger<WH639> also<WH1571> came up<WH5927> against Israel;<WH3478>
Because <WH3588> they believed<WH539> not<WH3808> in God,<WH430> and trusted<WH982> not<WH3808> in his salvation: <WH3444>
Though he had commanded<WH6680> the clouds<WH7834> from above,<WH4480> <WH4605> and opened<WH6605> the doors<WH1817> of heaven,<WH8064>
And had rained down<WH4305> manna<WH4478> upon<WH5921> them to eat,<WH398> and had given<WH5414> them of the corn<WH1715> of heaven.<WH8064>
Man <WH376> did eat<WH398> angels'<WH47> food:<WH3899> he sent<WH7971> them meat<WH6720> to the full.<WH7648>
He caused an east wind<WH6921> to blow<WH5265> in the heaven:<WH8064> and by his power<WH5797> he brought<WH5090> in the south wind.<WH8486>
He rained<WH4305> flesh<WH7607> also upon<WH5921> them as dust,<WH6083> and feathered<WH3671> fowls<WH5775> like as the sand<WH2344> of the sea: <WH3220>
And he let it fall<WH5307> in the midst<WH7130> of their camp,<WH4264> round about<WH5439> their habitations.<WH4908>
So they did eat,<WH398> and were well<WH3966> filled:<WH7646> for he gave<WH935> them their own desire;<WH8378>
They were not<WH3808> estranged<WH2114> from their lust.<WH4480> <WH8378> But while their meat<WH400> was yet<WH5750> in their mouths,<WH6310>
The wrath<WH639> of God<WH430> came<WH5927> upon them, and slew<WH2026> the fattest<WH4924> of them, and smote down<WH3766> the chosen<WH970> men of Israel.<WH3478>
For all<WH3605> this<WH2063> they sinned<WH2398> still,<WH5750> and believed<WH539> not<WH3808> for his wondrous works.<WH6381>
Therefore their days<WH3117> did he consume<WH3615> in vanity,<WH1892> and their years<WH8141> in trouble.<WH928>
When <WH518> he slew<WH2026> them, then they sought<WH1875> him: and they returned<WH7725> and inquired early<WH7836> after God.<WH410>
And they remembered<WH2142> that<WH3588> God<WH430> was their rock,<WH6697> and the high<WH5945> God<WH410> their redeemer.<WH1350>
Nevertheless they did flatter<WH6601> him with their mouth,<WH6310> and they lied<WH3576> unto him with their tongues.<WH3956>
For their heart<WH3820> was not right<WH3808> <WH3559> with<WH5973> him, neither<WH3808> were they steadfast<WH539> in his covenant.<WH1285>

But he,<WH1931> being full of compassion,<WH7349> forgave<WH3722> their iniquity,<WH5771> and destroyed<WH7843> them not:<WH3808> yea, many<WH7235> a time turned he his anger away,<WH639> <WH7725> and did not<WH3808> stir up<WH5782> all<WH3605> his wrath.<WH2534>
For he remembered<WH2142> that<WH3588> they<WH1992> were but flesh;<WH1320> a wind<WH7307> that passeth away,<WH1980> and cometh not again.<WH3808> <WH7725>
How oft<WH4100> did they provoke<WH4784> him in the wilderness,<WH4057> and grieve<WH6087> him in the desert!<WH3452>
Yea, they turned back<WH7725> and tempted<WH5254> God,<WH410> and limited<WH8428> the Holy One<WH6918> of Israel.<WH3478>
They remembered<WH2142> not<WH3808> <WH853> his hand,<WH3027> nor the day<WH3117> when<WH834> he delivered<WH6299> them from<WH4480> the enemy.<WH6862>
How <WH834> he had wrought<WH7760> his signs<WH226> in Egypt,<WH4714> and his wonders<WH4159> in the field<WH7704> of Zoan: <WH6814>
And had turned<WH2015> their rivers<WH2975> into blood;<WH1818> and their floods,<WH5140> that they could not<WH1077> drink.<WH8354>
He sent<WH7971> divers sorts of flies<WH6157> among them, which devoured<WH398> them; and frogs,<WH6854> which destroyed<WH7843> them.
He gave<WH5414> also their increase<WH2981> unto the caterpillar,<WH2625> and their labor<WH3018> unto the locust.<WH697>
He destroyed<WH2026> their vines<WH1612> with hail,<WH1259> and their sycamore trees<WH8256> with frost.<WH2602>
He gave up<WH5462> their cattle<WH1165> also to the hail,<WH1259> and their flocks<WH4735> to hot thunderbolts.<WH7565>
He cast<WH7971> upon them the fierceness<WH2740> of his anger,<WH639> wrath,<WH5678> and indignation,<WH2195> and trouble,<WH6869> by sending<WH4917> evil<WH7451> angels<WH4397> among them.
He made<WH6424> a way<WH5410> to his anger;<WH639> he spared<WH2820> not<WH3808> their soul<WH5315> from death,<WH4480> <WH4194> but gave<WH5462> their life<WH2416> over to the pestilence;<WH1698>
And smote<WH5221> all<WH3605> the firstborn<WH1060> in Egypt;<WH4714> the chief<WH7225> of their strength<WH202> in the tabernacles<WH168> of Ham: <WH2526>
But made his own people<WH5971> to go forth<WH5265> like sheep,<WH6629> and guided<WH5090> them in the wilderness<WH4057> like a flock.<WH5739>
And he led<WH5148> them on safely,<WH983> so that they feared<WH6342> not:<WH3808> but the sea<WH3220> overwhelmed<WH3680> their enemies.<WH341>
And he brought<WH935> them to<WH413> the border<WH1366> of his sanctuary,<WH6944> even to this<WH2088> mountain,<WH2022> which his right hand<WH3225> had purchased.<WH7069>

He cast out<WH1644> the heathen<WH1471> also before<WH4480> <WH6440> them, and divided<WH5307> them an inheritance<WH5159> by line,<WH2256> and made the tribes<WH7626> of Israel<WH3478> to dwell<WH7931> in their tents.<WH168>
Yet they tempted<WH5254> and provoked<WH4784> <WH853> the most high<WH5945> God,<WH430> and kept<WH8104> not<WH3808> his testimonies: <WH5713>
But turned back,<WH5472> and dealt unfaithfully<WH898> like their fathers:<WH1> they were turned aside<WH2015> like a deceitful<WH7423> bow.<WH7198>
For they provoked him to anger<WH3707> with their high places,<WH1116> and moved him to jealousy<WH7065> with their graven images.<WH6456>
When God<WH430> heard<WH8085> this, he was wroth,<WH5674> and greatly<WH3966> abhorred<WH3988> Israel: <WH3478>
So that he forsook<WH5203> the tabernacle<WH4908> of Shiloh,<WH7887> the tent<WH168> which he placed<WH7931> among men;<WH120>
And delivered<WH5414> his strength<WH5797> into captivity,<WH7628> and his glory<WH8597> into the enemy's<WH6862> hand.<WH3027>
He gave<WH5462> his people<WH5971> over<WH5462> also unto the sword;<WH2719> and was wroth<WH5674> with his inheritance.<WH5159>
The fire<WH784> consumed<WH398> their young men;<WH970> and their maidens<WH1330> were not<WH3808> given to marriage.<WH1984>
Their priests<WH3548> fell<WH5307> by the sword;<WH2719> and their widows<WH490> made no<WH3808> lamentation.<WH1058>
Then the Lord<WH136> awaked<WH3364> as one out of sleep,<WH3463> and like a mighty man<WH1368> that shouteth<WH7442> by reason of wine.<WH4480> <WH3196>
And he smote<WH5221> his enemies<WH6862> in the hinder parts:<WH268> he put<WH5414> them to a perpetual<WH5769> reproach.<WH2781>
Moreover he refused<WH3988> the tabernacle<WH168> of Joseph,<WH3130> and chose<WH977> not<WH3808> the tribe<WH7626> of Ephraim: <WH669>
But chose<WH977> <WH853> the tribe<WH7626> of Judah,<WH3063> <WH853> the mount<WH2022> Zion<WH6726> which<WH834> he loved.<WH157>
And he built<WH1129> his sanctuary<WH4720> like<WH3644> high<WH7311> palaces, like the earth<WH776> which he hath established<WH3245> forever.<WH5769>
He chose<WH977> David<WH1732> also his servant,<WH5650> and took<WH3947> him from the sheepfolds:<WH4480> <WH4356> <WH6629>
From following<WH4480> <WH310> the ewes great with young<WH5763> he brought<WH935> him to feed<WH7462> Jacob<WH3290> his people,<WH5971> and Israel<WH3478> his inheritance.<WH5159>
So he fed<WH7462> them according to the integrity<WH8537> of his heart;<WH3824> and guided<WH5148> them by the skilfulness<WH8394> of his hands.<WH3709>
